body: Can you try running `run_tests.py` with an extra `--disable_auto_set_flakes` flag? According to the log, things are failing with `Unexpected error getting flaky tests`

This error is not gone. However I ran into several other issues. I also hat to install the dotnetsdk, initialize the submodules (otherwise I get a dependency cycle error for zlib) and disable the "First time experience", as my fallback nuget folder is write protected (in /opt).

I have [updated my PR](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15099) with the instructions so far, now I am stuck at the following error which I am unable to resolve:
```bash
[nico@archlinuxpc grpc]$ DOTNET_SKIP_FIRST_TIME_EXPERIENCE=1 python2 tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -c dbg -l csharp --build_only --disable_auto_set_flakes

++ dirname tools/run_tests/helper_scripts/build_csharp.sh
+ cd tools/run_tests/helper_scripts/../../../src/csharp
+ '[' dbg == gcov ']'
+ dotnet build --configuration Debug Grpc.sln
```

I'm sorry you're having trouble with building. I'm updating the build instructions in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15178.

About the other failures
- we should probably disable the `auto_set_flakes`  feature in run_tests.py by default.  I might do that in a separate PR.
- the "Reference assemblies not found" problem is actually  https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/335 and it's a problem with dotnet SDK itself, not really a gRPC specific issue. We did our best to work around the problem here https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/246071a4e22d3d2ea19dad8714b19ef2dae5464a/src/csharp/Grpc.Core/Common.csproj.include#L23, but that workaround might not work for Arch Linux (I suspect you can fix it by providing the right `FrameworkPathOverride` value for your system)
- the problem with "First time experience" of dotnet SDK breaking your build seems to be a problem with dotnet SDK installation for Arch Linux being broken. I don't think it's reasonable to make our build instructions more convoluted to workaround a non-grpc specific problem on a single linux distribution.

I hope with modifying the workaround for https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/335 you should be able to build successfully.

The problem was that I did not install mono. I am not sure why the .net framework/mono is required here, but now grpc builds. I expected it would just build with .net core.

Could you please give me a quick guidiance on how to use the final build in my (windows) c# solution for testing the uwp bug? Which files do I have to use?

@AtosNicoS  you basically need to take Grpc.Core.dll (the C# assembly)  you just built after changing the C# core as instructed in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/8636#issuecomment-382278725 and replacing the Grpc.Core.dll in the .nupkg file (the nupkg file is just a zipfile, so this should be doable) and then use the nupkg file for testing.  There might be other ways but I'll leave that up to you.
